THANKS: Thank you very much for your participation!
DATATEXT:
Based on article 13 of the federal constitution of switzerland and the federal dataprotection assignments (Datenschutzgesetz, DSG) every person has a right for the protection of her privacy, aswell as the protction of misuse of her personal data. We keep those assignments.

Personal data is handled strictly confidential and is only used by the MitrendS Team (BFH) and by the Departement of Neurology of the University Hospital Zurich (UHZ) in the context of the bachelor thesis during the spring semester 2017.

By using our App, following data will be stored in a logfile: your answers from the questionnaires, evaluation data from the tests (your score). This data is used for statistic and anonyme evaluation and validation of the MitrendS App.
IMP_TEXT: This App was developped during the bachelor thesis by two students of the health informatics department of the University of Applied Sciences of Bern for the neurology department of the University Hospital Zurich.
IMP_CONTACT: You have a question or feedback?
PLEASE: Please choose for every question an answer
TRY_LAB_TEXT: A way through the Labyrinth is shown to you now. You have to do it by yourself afterwards. Click OK whenever you are ready
DO_WAY: Please try to do the shown way. Begin at the START point!
Q2COREL: Do you have movementrestrictions in your left hand?
Q2CORER: Do you have movementrestrictions in your right hand?
Q3COREL: Do you have sensory disturbances in your left hand?
Q3CORER: Do you have sensory disturbances in your right hand?
Q5CORE: How do you judge your current concentration abilities?
Q6CORE: Had you a MS relapse since the last exercise session?
Q7CORE: Did your MS Symptome increase since the last exercise session?
TEMPLATEPOPUP_NEXTPREPZS: Now the prepartion starts, the actual exercise with a defined amount of time, will start after this preparation.
SDTEMPLATE_POPUP: The preparation is over. As soon as you click OK, the actual exercise starts.

QS1.text: ... Grip things tightly (e.g. turning on taps)?

QS2_2.text: ... Tremor of your arms or legs?
... Your body not doing what you want it to do?
... Having to depend on others to do things for you?
... Limitations in your social and leisure activities at home?
... Being stuck at home more than you would like to be?
... Difficulties using your hands in everyday tasks?

QS2_3.text: ... Having to cut down the amount of time you spent on work or other daily activities?
... Problems using transport (e.g. car, bus, train, taxi, etc.)?
... Difficulty doing things spontaneously (e.g. going out on the spur of the moment)?
... Needing to go to the toilet urgently?

QS2_4.text: ... Feeling irritable, impatient, or short tempered?

MSISQS1: In the past two weeks, how much has your MS limited your ability to...
MSISQS2: In the past two weeks, how much have you been bothered by...
ZS-INSTRUCTION: Choose according to the referencetable, the appropriate digit of the digittable to the symbol, in the table, from left to right.
FSS_Q: During the past week, I have found that:

QUESTIONS.text: My motivation is lower when I am fatigued.
Fatigue interferes with my physical functioning.
Fatigue causes frequent problems for me.
My fatigue prevents sustained physical functioning.
Fatigue interferes with carrying out certain duties and responsibilities.
Fatigue is among my most disabling symptoms.
Fatigue interferes with my work, family, or social life.
